isis.stitle: CAB: DAYCAB AND SLEEPER CAB for ProStar, ProStar Premium, and ProStar Limited Models - REMOVE - IGNITION SWITCH AND IGNITION SWITCH CYLINDER

svcproc.title: IGNITION SWITCH AND IGNITION SWITCH CYLINDER

svcprocinfo.para: The ignition switch and door locks are coded the same so that one key operates ignition switch and door locks. The code number is stamped and bar coded on a plastic bag that the ignition switch and door lock cylinders are supplied in at the assembly plant. This plastic bag is to remain with the vehicle when it is delivered to the customer. It is very important that this plastic bag be kept by the customer in a safe, secure place, so that if a replacement key is required, the key can be replaced.
The code number does not appear on ignition switch body or door lock assembly.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Ignition Switch on Daycab and Sleeper Cab
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 20 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: The ignition switch is located to the right of the driver in the instrument panel (Item 1) at the bottom of instrument panel. Remove ignition switch as follows.
Remove center trim panel (Item 2) from instrument panel (Item 1) to expose ignition switch (Item 3) and mounting cap nut (Item 4).
Using a 1 1/8 inch thin wall socket, unscrew mounting cap nut (Item 4) and remove it from ignition switch (Item 3).

figure.caption: Figure 20. Ignition Switch and Cap Nut

step1.para: Reach up behind instrument panel (Item 1) and pull ignition switch (Item 3) out of instrument panel and pull it down below instrument panel.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 21 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Disconnect ignition switch connector (Item 1) from the back of the ignition switch (Item 2) and remove ignition switch from vehicle.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Ignition Switch Cylinder from Ignition Switch on Daycab and Sleeper Cab
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 22 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Insert ignition key (Item 1) into ignition switch (Item 2) and rotate counterclockwise to accessory position, so that the key is lined up with release hole (Item 3) in ignition switch body (Item 4).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Position Ignition Switch in Accessory Position

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 23 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para:
Insert a 1/16 inch (1.6 mm) diameter rod (paper clip) (Item 1) into release hole (Item 3, Figure 22)
in ignition switch body (Item 2) of ignition switch and depress switch cylinder retainer.

figure.caption: Figure 23. Switch Cylinder and Ignition Switch Body

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 24 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Pull complete ignition switch cylinder (Item 1) using ignition key (Item 3) from ignition switch body (Item 2).

figure.caption: Figure 24. Remove or Install Switch Cylinder

note.para: If vehicle keys are lost, drill out switch cylinder. Using a 5/16 inch (8 mm) drill bit, drill 1/2 to 3/4 inch (12.7 to 19 mm) deep. This will permit tumblers to drop out and free switch cylinder.
